abstract: British Foreign Sec Philip Hammond will reopen Great Britain's embassy in Tehran; four years after ambassador's residence there was plundered by protesters, who also burned British flag; destruction was in reaction to economic sanctions imposed upon Iran in 2011, and decision to reopen embassy is strong signal that Western relations with Iran have improved following nuclear accord with United Nations.
lead_paragraph: Foreign Secretary Philip Hammond is likely to reopen the embassy in Tehran on Sunday, in a significant indication of warming Western relations with Iran.

headline.main: Britain to Reopen Embassy in Iran, Nearly 4 Years After It Was Ransacked
headline.print_headline: Britain to Reopen Embassy Attacked in Tehran in 2011

snippet: Foreign Secretary Philip Hammond is likely to reopen the embassy in Tehran on Sunday, in a significant indication of warming Western relations with Iran.
